intro: Rauvolfia insularis, commonly known as the island rosy periwinkle, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as tropical forests. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Rauvolfia insularis is also known for its medicinal properties, particularly due to the alkaloids it contains.
